description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Restructure the Identities page into a channel-centric layout for easier multi-identity management.
- Refine MCP page UX and related copy/strings for clearer auth and configuration flows.
Fixes & polish
- Translation/copy updates for identity + MCP surfaces.
- Minor server + desktop version alignment updates included in the patch bump.
Packaging / ops
- Update Docker dev stack helper scripts and compose settings.
- AUR packaging metadata updates.
Compare:
https://github.com/different-ai/openwork/compare/v0.11.40...v0.11.41
